title: Power Platform Analyst
description:
JOB OVERVIEW

We are a US-based Managed Service Provider (MSP) seeking a highly analytical and solution-oriented Power Platform Analyst to join our growing team. This role is perfect for someone who thrives at the intersection of business process and technical automation. You won't just be building apps; you will be architecting systems that bridge the gap between complex business requirements and high-performance digital solutions.

 

As a Power Platform Analyst, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and debugging automated workflows and data visualizations. You will work closely with stakeholders to translate their needs into scalable solutions using the Microsoft Power Platform and enterprise integration tools like Boomi. If you are a proactive problem-solver with a passion for APIs and automation, we want to meet you!

 

Key Responsibilities:

Solution Design: Translate complex business requirements into technical specifications and end-to-end solutions.

Automation & Integration: Build and maintain sophisticated workflows using Power Automate and integrate various systems via Boomi and APIs.



Data Visualization: Design and deploy insightful Power BI dashboards that drive data-informed decision-making.

System Debugging: Proactively identify, troubleshoot, and resolve issues within existing flows, apps, and integrations.

Process Optimization: Analyze current business processes and recommend automated improvements to increase efficiency.

Documentation: Maintain thorough documentation of system architectures, API mappings, and workflow logic to ensure transparency.



Technologies You’ll Work With:

- Microsoft Power Platform: Power Automate (Flow), Power BI, and Power Apps.

- Integration Tools: Boomi (AtomSphere) and Custom API Connectors.

- Data & APIs: REST/SOAP APIs, JSON, SQL, and OData.

- Cloud Ecosystem: Microsoft 365, SharePoint, and Dataverse.



What We’re Looking For:

- Proven Experience: At least 2-3 years of experience building enterprise-grade solutions within the Power Platform.

Integration Expertise: Strong understanding of APIs and experience using middleware (like Boomi) to move data between systems.

- Analytical Mindset: Ability to "deconstruct" a business problem and rebuild it as a logical, automated process.

- Debugging Skills: A systematic approach to troubleshooting complex logic and connectivity issues.

- Communication: Excellent English communication skills, with the ability to explain technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.



Preferred but Not Required:

- Certifications such as PL-100 (App Maker), PL-200 (Functional Consultant), or PL-400 (Developer).

- Experience with DAX, Power Query (M), or basic JavaScript/JSON.

- Familiarity with ERP or CRM integrations.



Why Join Us?

We believe in creating an environment where our tea
mbers can thrive both professionally and personally. Here’s what we offer:

* Career Growth: Paid certifications, training, and structured onboarding to help you advance your skills.

* Attractive Compensation: Competitive salary, performance-based incentives (monthly profit share and end-of-year bonus), and 13th-month pay.

* Health & Wellness: Monthly healthcare allowance to support your well-being.

* Work-Life Balance: 100% remote work with company-provided equipment.

Supportive Culture: Be part of a forward-thinking team that values collaboration, innovation, and having fun while doing great work.



What Sets Us Apart?

* Performance-Based Rewards: Monthly profit sharing and bonuses for high-performing tea
mbers.

* Continuous Learning: We invest in your growth with paid certifications and training.

* Collaborative Environment: Work with a team that values your input and supports your success.

* Flexibility: Enjoy the freedom of remote work while contributing to impactful projects.



How to Apply:

If you’re ready to take your career to the next level as a Power Platform Analyst, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and join a team that’s passionate about technology, growth, and delivering exceptional service.



**Submit your application and include the numbers (2027) in your subject line. This helps us ensure you’ve read the full job description.



**Please also attach your updated CV to your application or provide a link to your CV. Applications without a CV will not be considered.

 

*Currently looking for candidates in NCR or nearby areas of the Philippines.

 

This is an overnight position. The working hours for this role are 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM CST Monday to Friday.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Junior IT Engineer
description:
Job Overview

 

We are a US-based Managed Service Provider (MSP) seeking a Junior IT Engineer to join our growing remote team. This role is ideal for candidates with 0–3 years of experience who are passionate about technology and eager to grow in a supportive environment.

 

You’ll start by focusing on day-to-day technical support and gradually take on more project-related tasks as your skills develop. You’ll work closely with senior engineers, receive structured onboarding, and get real-world exposure to modern IT environments, tools, and best practices.

 

 If you enjoy troubleshooting, learning new technologies, and providing great service to users, we’d love to hear from you.

 

 Key Responsibilities: 

*Technical Support (Level 1–2)

   - Provide remote technical support for hardware, software, and basic network issues.

   - Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to desktops, laptops, printers, and peripherals.

   - Escalate more complex problems to senior engineers when needed, while staying involved to learn from the resolution.

*PC Maintenance & Setup

  - Perform PC maintenance, upgrades, and new workstation installations.

  - Install and configure standard software and tools according to company and client standards.

*User Support & Remote Work

  - Manage and support user equipment, software, and services remotely using our remote management tools.

  - Guide end users through basic troubleshooting steps in a clear and professional manner.

*Documentation & Ticketing

  - Document all work accurately and thoroughly in the ticketing system.

  - Keep tickets updated with progress notes and resolutions to ensure transparency and team collaboration.

*Project Assistance (as you grow)

  - Assist senior engineers with IT projects such as small deployments, migrations, and network changes.

  - Follow implementation plans and checklists, gradually taking more ownership as your experience increases.



Technologies You’ll Work With:

You don’t need to be an expert in everything on day one, but familiarity with some of these is a strong plus, and we’ll help you grow into the rest:



*Operating Systems

   - Windows desktop environments (Windows 10/11)

   - Mac (basic support is a plus)

   - Windows Server (exposure/interest is a plus)

*Networking

   - Basic networking concepts (IP addressing, DNS, DHCP, Wi-Fi)

   - Exposure to devices like Cisco, Ubiquiti, Fortinet is a plus

*Cloud Platforms

   - Microsoft 365 (user management,
, basic administration)

  - Basic understanding or interest in Azure is a plus



What We’re Looking For:

*Experience & Background

  - 0–3 years of experience in an IT Support, Helpdesk, or related technical role.

  - Experience in an MSP environment is a plus but not required.

  - Recent graduates or career shifters with strong foundational knowledge are welcome to apply.

*Skills & Mindset

  - Strong basic troubleshooting skills for hardware, software, and simple network issues.

  - Familiarity with Microsoft 365 and Windows environments.

  - Good English communication skills (spoken and written).

  - Excellent customer service mindset – patient, professional, and user-focused.

  - A proactive, problem-solving approach with a strong desire to learn and grow.

  - Ability to work independently while being an active part of a remote team.



Preferred but Not Required:

These are nice-to-haves, not must-haves. We’re happy to help you grow into them:



* IT certifications such as CompTIA A+, Network+, Microsoft Fundamentals, or similar.

* Exposure to firewalls, VPNs, and virtual environments (Hyper-V, VMware, etc.).

* Experience with RMM and ticketing tools used in MSPs.



Why Join Us?



We believe in creating an environment where our tea
mbers can thrive both professionally and personally. Here’s what we offer:



*Career Growth: Paid certifications, training, and structured onboarding to help you advance your skills.

*Attractive Compensation: Competitive salary, performance-based incentives (monthly profit share and end-of-year bonus), and 13th-month pay.

*Health & Wellness: Monthly healthcare allowance to support your well-being.

*Work-Life Balance: 100% remote work with company-provided equipment.

*Supportive Culture: Be part of a forward-thinking team that values collaboration, innovation, and having fun while doing great work.



What Sets Us Apart?



*Performance-Based Rewards: Monthly profit sharing and bonuses for high-performing tea
mbers.

*Continuous Learning: We invest in your growth with paid certifications and training.

*Collaborative Environment: Work with a team that values your input and supports your success.

*Flexibility: Enjoy the freedom of remote work while contributing to impactful projects.



How to Apply

If you’re ready to take your IT career to the next level, we’d love to hear from you! Apply now and join a team that’s passionate about technology, growth, and delivering exceptional service.



**Submit your application and include the numbers (2019) in your subject line. This helps us ensure you’ve read the full job description.



**Please also attach your updated CV to your application or provide a link to your CV. Applications without a CV will not be considered.



**Currently looking for candidates in NCR or nearby areas of the Philippines



This is an overnight position. The working hours for this role are 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM CST Monday to Friday.



We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Creative Generalist
description:
We’re hiring a Creative Generalist with strong design and video editing chops to produce compelling visual assets for our paid media campaigns, landing pages, and brand communication. This hybrid role supports 2–3 DTC brands to start and is perfect for someone who thrives on fast-paced creative production, balancing aesthetics with performance goals.



This role also requires basic graphic design, website content uploads, and Shopify management. The ideal candidate should have a balance of creative and technical skills (including light coding for layout and animation adjustments), combining design and execution to help eliminate handoff delays.



Key Responsibilities:

- Design and edit a wide range of creative assets, including static banners, carousels, GIFs, and video ads for Meta, TikTok, and Google platforms.

- Craft compelling UGC ad edits by applying high-impact hooks, on-brand CTAs, dynamic captions, jump cuts, transitions, and subtitles.

- Create and repurpose social proof assets (testimonials, influencer screenshots, reviews) for use in paid ads and organic content.

- Produce eye-catching
 headers, promotional visuals, and SMS campaign assets that reinforce brand identity and drive engagement.

- Design and stylize reviews, influencer callouts, and customer testimonials into digestible, trust-building creatives. This includes screenshot treatments, branded overlays, and animated quote snippets used across paid and organic channels.

- Build static and motion creatives tailored to platform-specific best practices for Meta and TikTok.

- Balance visual design with performance marketing needs, ensuring every creative asset contributes to ROAS and CAC goals.

- Maintain brand consistency while adapting messaging across various visual formats and placements.

- Collaborate with media buyers, brand managers, and other creatives to meet deadlines and exceed campaign goals.

- Stay up-to-date on creative trends, ad formats, and what’s performing across DTC brands.

- Manage Shopify content updates and product visuals across multiple sites.

- Perform light coding for layout refinements and simple animations to enhance design execution.

- Combine both creative design and technical implementation to streamline production and reduce handoff delays.



Qualifications:

- At least 2 years of experience in graphic design and video editing for digital marketing.

- Advanced skills in Adobe Creative Suite (Photoshop, Illustrator, Premiere Pro, and  After Effects).

- Proven experience creating high-converting static and motion ads for Meta, TikTok, or Google.

- Strong eye for layout, color, typography, and brand consistency.

- Experience editing UGC and social proof content for performance-driven campaigns.

- Able to follow creative briefs, meet tight deadlines, and collaborate well with remote teams.

- Portfolio demonstrating versatility across static design, motion, and video editing.

- Preferred: Basic Shopify management, including uploading content and maintaining visual consistency.

- Basic knowledge of HTML/CSS for light coding and layout adjustments.



What We Offer:

- Competitive salary base

- Permanent remote setup

- Unlimited free access to MAG School courses and SOP Library

- Opportunities for professional development and career advancement



Your next big move starts here. If you’re ready to grow with a team that values your potential, apply now!



Feel free to reach out at 
 with any follow-up.

title: Creative Strategist
description:
The Creative Strategist will own the research, ideation, and optimization of creative assets across paid ads,
/SMS, landing pages, and UGC. They'll translate brand goals, market data, and consumer psychology into briefs, scripts, and testing roadmaps, partnering with designers, editors, media buyers, and UGC creators to execute.



This role focuses on conversion optimization and creative direction — guiding creative generalists, reviewing and approving output, and ensuring all creatives are aligned with CRO goals. The strategist does not handle direct web design, but must have strong CRO experience to boost campaign effectiveness.



Key Responsibilities:

- Analyze client creative performance, benchmark competitors, and identify positioning and messaging opportunities across the full funnel.

- Develop creative roadmaps for DTC brands, concept new hooks and angles, and build testing frameworks across multiple ad formats.

- Create detailed UGC briefs, collaborate with creators through production, and curate social proof for ads and owned channels.

- Partner with media buyers and cross-functional teams to ensure creative aligns with funnel stages, KPIs, and brand standards.

- Guide creative generalists and support
/SMS and CRO-focused landing page strategy without executing web design.

- Track and interpret performance data, document insights, and iterate continuously to optimize campaigns.

- Present strategies, testing plans, and performance recaps to clients and internal leadership to support retention and revenue goals.



Qualifications:     

- Proven experience in Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) and creative strategy for digital marketing.

- Ability to analyze creative performance metrics and translate data insights into actionable design or messaging improvements.

- Strong leadership and feedback skills to guide generalists and align creative output with performance goals.

- Ability to drive creative decisions that enhance campaign effectiveness and conversion rates.



What We Offer:

- Competitive salary base

- Permanent remote setup

- Unlimited free access to MAG School courses and SOP Library

title: Outbound Sales Development Representative
description:
This role is strategically focused on generating new business opportunities through targeted outbound outreach. The Outbound SDR serves as the first point of contact for potential clients, identifying prospects, initiating conversations, and driving them into the sales pipeline. You will manage outbound campaigns, conduct personalized outreach, and build strong engagement with high-value leads. This position requires strong persistence, excellent communication skills, and the ability to build effective processes for high-touch outbound engagement.



Goal:

To create a steady flow of qualified outbound opportunities by identifying, engaging, and advancing potential clients into meaningful sales conversations.



Key Responsibilities:

- Outbound Prospecting: Identify and target potential clients through
, calls, and social outreach to generate qualified leads for the sales team.

- Personalized Outreach: Create tailored messaging for specific industries, decision-makers, or company profiles to increase engagement and response rates.

- Pipeline Generation: Build and maintain a strong pipeline of outbound leads, ensuring consistent activity and follow-ups.

- Lead Qualification: Evaluate outbound prospects to ensure alignment with service offerings and pass qualified opportunities to the sales team.

- Collaboration With Sales & Marketing: Work closely with sales to refine ideal client profiles and with marketing to improve outbound messaging and campaign performance.

- CRM Management: Keep detailed, accurate records of outreach activity, follow-ups, and prospect interactions within the CRM.

- Process Building & Optimization: Develop, refine, and scale processes for efficient and high-touch outbound engagement.



Qualifications:

- Experience in outbound sales, lead generation, or a similar role is preferred.

- Strong organizational skills with excellent attention to detail.

- Proven track record of consistently meeting or exceeding outreach and pipeline targets.

- Advanced knowledge of HubSpot preferred; experience with other CRM tools is a plus.

- Exceptional verbal and written communication skills

- Motivated self-starter with the ability to work independently and drive tasks forward.

- Comfortable with leadership, taking initiative, and improving workflows.

- Strong interpersonal skills: able to communicate value clearly, handle objections, and build rapport during outbound conversations.

- Has a history of building processes around high-touch outbound client engagement.



What We Offer:

- Competitive salary base

- Permanent WFH setup

- Unlimited FREE access to MAG School courses and SOP Library!

- Work schedule is in EST (Monday-Friday only)

- Opportunities for professional development and career advancement



Why wait for permission to level up? Apply now and step into a role where your skills are truly valued.



Follow up anytime at

title: Naturhin Hair Care Brand Copywriter
description:
Position: Beauty Brand Copywriter

 Type: Part-Time / Freelance

 Salary Range: Competitive (based on experience)



   About Naturhin

Naturhin is a premium natural haircare brand designed for curls, coils, and textured hair. Our brand voice is confident, warm, nature-driven, and educational. We aim to empower natural beauty through science-backed and nature-rooted storytelling.

   Role Overview

We are looking for a Beauty Brand Copywriter who can bring Naturhin’s tone of voice to life across all online platforms. This role is essential in shaping Naturhin’s identity and messaging across our website, social media, and launch campaigns.

  Responsibilities

Write IG/TikTok captions that match Naturhin’s tone

Write product descriptions (benefits, routines, key ingredients)

Create ingredient highlight copy

Write brand story & core messaging

Write website content (homepage, product pages, about page)

Assist with
 sequences (prelaunch + launch)

Support content creation for educational posts

Ensure brand voice consistency





  Qualifications

Required:

Experience writing for beauty, skincare, haircare, or wellness brands

Strong grasp of brand tone & messaging

Clean grammar and excellent writing skills

Ability to write short-form (captions) and long-form (website content)

Creativity + clarity in writing

Ability to translate product benefits into compelling text





Bonus Points:

Knows trends in IG/TikTok captions

Familiar with US/UK beauty niches

Experience writing launch campaigns





  How to Apply

Send the following to: [naturhin
]

Writing samples (beauty/wellness strongly preferred)

Short introduction about yourself

Portfolio link (if available)

title: E-Commerce Launch & Operations Specialist – Luxury Online Boutique
description:
Styled by Nikki is a curated online fashion closet featuring one-of-a-kind pieces — vintage high-end finds, designer resale, custom handmade garments, and rare statement pieces.



This is not a mass inventory boutique.

This is a product-first, founder-led brand operating through exclusive weekly curated drops.



We are seeking a highly organized and experienced E-Commerce Operations Specialist to build and manage the backend infrastructure of our Shopify store and oversee ongoing weekly drop management.



?



Role Overview



This role is responsible for building the Shopify store, creating structured inventory systems for one-of-one pieces, and managing weekly product releases with precision and accuracy.



This is not a social media role.

This is not a general assistant role.

This is an operations-focused position requiring systems thinking and e-commerce experience.



?



Core Responsibilities



Shopify Store Build & Management

	•	Build and structure Shopify store from the ground up

	•	Set up collections and navigation for a curated closet model

	•	Optimize product pages and mobile experience

	•	Configure payment, shipping, and checkout systems

	•	Maintain backend store accuracy



?



One-of-a-Kind Inventory & Product Systems

	•	Create and manage a SKU system for one-of-one pieces

	•	Develop and maintain inventory tracking spreadsheet

	•	Accurately track custom, vintage, and designer items

	•	Prevent overselling through precise system management

	•	Organize digital folders for product photography and documentation



?



Weekly Drop Management

	•	Manage weekly product intake and upload process

	•	Prepare product listings for scheduled drops

	•	Ensure all listings are formatted and optimized before release

	•	Coordinate drop scheduling inside Shopify

	•	Maintain consistency in product organization



?



Luxury Resale & Authentication Workflow

	•	Research pricing comps for designer resale items

	•	Coordinate third-party authentication services (Entrupy, LegitGrails, etc.)

	•	Track authentication status and documentation

	•	Upload certificates and condition notes accurately

	•	Ensure resale compliance and documentation is structured



?



Required Experience

	•	Proven Shopify store build experience (must provide links)

	•	Strong e-commerce operations background

	•	Experience managing one-of-a-kind or limited inventory products

	•	Inventory management and SKU system development experience

	•	Experience uploading and optimizing product listings

	•	Strong written English skills



?



Preferred Experience

	•	Experience with boutique or resale fashion brands

	•	Experience coordinating luxury authentication services

	•	Experience managing recurring or weekly product drops

	•
 capture and basic Shopify
 setup knowledge



?



Ideal Candidate

	•	Thinks in systems, not just tasks

	•	Highly organized and detail-oriented

	•	Comfortable building workflows from scratch

	•	Understands structured backend operations

	•	Can manage ongoing weekly inventory updates without error

	•	Has a long-term mindset and wants to grow with a brand



?



Important Notes



This is a product-first brand with weekly curated drops.

Accuracy, organization, and backend precision are critical.



If you do not have direct Shopify and inventory management experience, this role will not be a fit.



?



To Apply



Please include:

	1.	Links to Shopify stores you have built or managed

	2.	A brief explanation of how you structure inventory for one-of-a-kind products

	3.	Your hourly rate

	4.	Your availability for U.S. time overlap

	5.	The word “CLOSET” in your application

title: Marketing and Social Media Manager
description:
Marketing and Social Media Manager

Remote | Part Time

Starting at 550 USD per month plus performance incentives



We are looking for a strategic Marketing and Social Media Manager who does not just post content but builds brand presence and drives real business results.



Our client operates in the AV and IT integration space, delivering advanced technology solutions across unified communications, digital signage, and network infrastructure. This is your chance to translate complex technical solutions into compelling stories that generate leads and position the company as an industry authority.



If you enjoy turning technical projects into powerful marketing narratives and want to own strategy, not just execution, this role is for you.



What You Will Own



• Develop and execute a full digital marketing strategy aligned with growth goals

• Manage LinkedIn, Instagram, and X with consistent high quality content

• Create case studies, blog posts, white papers, and video scripts that showcase real world projects

• Oversee and optimize the company website with strong SEO and user experience focus

• Launch and manage
 campaigns to nurture leads and support sales

• Track marketing performance and present insights that drive smarter decisions

• Collaborate closely with sales and technical teams to highlight project wins

• Support trade shows and industry events with coordinated marketing materials



What Makes You a Strong Fit



• 3 to 5 years of experience in digital marketing or social media management

• Experience in technology, construction, AV, IT, or professional services industries

• Strong content writing and storytelling skills for both B2B and B2C audiences

• Familiar with SEO, Google Analytics, CRM platforms, and marketing automation tools

• Comfortable working independently and managing multiple deadlines

• Passionate about technology and digital marketing trends



What You Get



• Fully remote work setup

• Flexible schedule with performance based expectations

• Direct exposure to executive level strategy and decision making

• Opportunity to build and own the marketing function

• Performance bonus opportunities based on lead generation and campaign results

• Annual salary review based on performance

• Paid time off after probation period

• Professional development support for online courses or certifications

• Long term growth opportunity as the brand expands



This is not a content posting job. This is a strategic growth role.



If you want to build something meaningful and see your ideas directly impact revenue and brand authority, we would love to hear from you.

title: Senior Paid Social Video Editor
description:
To be considered for this role, please apply directly through our careers page so we can properly review your application.



Fill out the application form here: 



Job Title: Senior Paid Social Video Editor

Location: Remote

Reports To: TBD

Work Shift: Flexible, with required overlap between 7:00–11:00 AM CET

Working Hours: Full-time; 40 hours per week



Job Description:



We are seeking a Senior Paid Social Video Editor to join a creative-first growth partner working with leading DTC brands across the US, Canada, and Europe. This role is strictly execution-focused and centered on producing high-performing paid social video ads that meet a clearly defined quality bar.

You will work from approved concepts, scripts, and creative briefs provided by Creative Strategists and Copywriters. Your responsibility is to execute at a high creative and technical level, delivering performance-ready ads that match or exceed provided reference examples.



Key Responsibilities:

Video Editing & Production (Primary Focus)

Edit paid social video ads for platforms including Meta and TikTok

Transform raw footage, UGC, AI-generated assets, and supplied materials into polished, conversion-focused ads

Execute edits with strong pacing, visual hierarchy, and storytelling aligned to performance marketing best practices

Add motion graphics, captions, subtitles, hooks, and overlays where appropriate

Ensure all deliverables meet platform specs and internal quality standards

Maintain premium visual quality, no low-effort or “dropshipping-style” edits

  

AI-First Creative Execution (Baseline Requirement)

Generate and integrate AI video, image, voice-over, and music assets using tools such as Higgsfield, Nanobanana, ElevenLabs, Suno.ai, and similar platforms

Use AI intentionally to enhance creative output, not as a shortcut for low-quality production

Continuously improve AI workflows to increase efficiency, iteration speed, and creative range

Execution Within Creative Direction

Execute strictly within approved briefs, concepts, and reference examples

Ask clarifying questions when inputs are unclear to avoid rework

Apply initiative to elevate edits while staying aligned with brand and strategy

Adapt visual style per brand (e.g., premium, minimal, bold, playful)

Creative Collaboration

Collaborate closely with Creative Strategists and Copywriters during production cycles

Review scripts, storyboards, and shot lists and flag execution considerations early

Share relevant creative trends, AI techniques, and production improvements

Contribute to improving internal video workflows and standards



Qualifications:

2+ years of hands-on experience editing paid social video ads

Ability to produce work equal to or better than the following reference quality:



Strong, practical experience using AI tools in video/image/audio production workflows

Proven portfolio of Meta and TikTok ads, ideally with ad spend or performance context (USD)

Advanced proficiency in Adobe Premiere Pro

Solid understanding of pacing, hooks, retention, and performance-driven editing

Ability to follow briefs precisely while thinking independently

Experience handling multiple projects with consistent on-time delivery

Fluent written and spoken English



Nice-to-Have:

Experience with After Effects / motion graphics

Background working with DTC e-commerce brands

Familiarity with creative testing frameworks and iterative ad production

Ability to explain why past ads performed well (creative reasoning, not strategy ownership)

Benefits:

Fully remote role

Generous PTO and holiday allowance

Collaborative, high-performance creative environment

Access to training, paid courses, and conferences

Annual international team retreats

Clear growth path with regular reviews and bonus opportunities





Why join More Staffing?

-No pay cuts/agency fees you earn your full salary

-Work directly under the client (100% remote)

-Executive coaching & career support

-Supported from day one

-Be part of a strong Philippine talent pipeline

-Talent referral program

title: Automation Specialist  with Learning and Development
description:
About Bare:



At Bare, we're focused on bringing end-of-life planning into the digital age and, along the way, making a real impact on people at a time in their lives that really matters.



Since launching in 2019 we've grown exponentially. Bare started out as a direct-to-consumer funeral home offering a digitally enabled, low-cost funeral service. We've since expanded to become Australia's leading provider of prepaid funerals, online wills, online estate planning, and pet funerals. Our vision is to become the end-of-life CRM, supporting individuals and families to deal with a difficult topic in an empathic, affordable, and sustainable way.



The exciting part? The journey has only just started. We are backed by some of Australia's highest profile investors, are currently one of the fastest growing companies in Australia, and we're committed to making a difference. Join us on the ground and be intimately involved in the creation and development of a product and service that is category-leading.

The Role:



We’re looking for a Training, Learning & Automation Specialist to design, build and scale our internal learning ecosystem while embedding automation and AI-driven efficiency across training, onboarding and operational workflows.

This is not a traditional L&D role. You’ll sit at the intersection of people, systems, and technology — creating structured learning programs while automating repetitive processes to support a fast-growing, multi-functional team.

You’ll work closely with Operations, Customer Care, Sales, Finance and Leadership to ensure our team is highly trained, efficient, and continuously improving.



Key Responsibilities:



Learning & Development:



-Design and deliver structured onboarding programs across departments (Funeral Arrangers, Sales, Operations, Finance).

-Build scalable e-learning modules, SOP documentation and knowledge libraries.

-Create competency frameworks and capability pathways.

-Facilitate live and virtual training sessions.

-Develop assessment tools to measure skill acquisition and performance uplift.

-Maintain compliance training relevant to Australian funeral and regulatory requirements.



Systems & Automation:



-Identify repetitive manual processes and design automated workflows.

-Implement automation tools (CRM automations, LMS workflows, AI-based support tools).

-Integrate training content into internal systems for seamless adoption.

-Build dashboards to track learning progress, productivity and operational KPIs.

-Collaborate with tech and operations teams to improve internal tooling.





Continuous Improvement:



-Analyse performance data to identify skill gaps.

-Translate operational bottlenecks into structured learning solutions.

-Implement feedback loops to refine training programs.

-Support change management during process or system upgrades.



What Success Looks Like:



-New hires reach full productivity faster.

-Training is systemised, documented and easily scalable.

-Manual tasks are reduced through automation.

-Teams demonstrate measurable performance improvement.

-Leadership has visibility on capability metrics.



About You:



-3+ years in Learning & Development, Enablement, Operations Improvement or similar.

-Experience implementing automation tools (e.g., Zapier, HubSpot workflows, Notion, LMS platforms, AI tools).

-Strong systems thinker who enjoys process optimisation.

-Comfortable working in a fast-paced startup environment.

-Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

-Highly organised with strong attention to detail.

-Analytical and data-driven in decision making.

-Proactive, solution-oriented and commercially aware.

-Experience in xero, google sheet and CRM (Hubspot) and integrations between systems



Bonus Experience:



-Experience in high-growth startups.

-Experience in regulated industries.

-Familiarity with CRM systems and workflow automation.

-Exposure to AI tools for training and operational efficiency.



Please include your resume in your application.

title: UK-Experienced Bookkeeper (Xero) – Must Have UK Accounting Firm Experience
description:
We are a UK-based accounting firm operating under two brands:



• Walji & Co – a long-established UK practice

• Capture Accounting – specialist accountants for content creators and social media influencers



We are growing and looking for a serious, experienced UK bookkeeper to join our remote team.



We already have three Filipino tea
mbers and we are looking to expand carefully with the right person.



This is NOT a basic data entry role.

This is NOT an accounts payable/receivable clerk role.



We are looking for someone who understands UK bookkeeping properly.



Important – Please Read Before Applying



You MUST have:



• At least 3+ years experience working in a UK accounting firm or servicing UK clients

• Experience preparing and reviewing UK VAT returns

• Strong Xero knowledge (confident, not beginner)

• Experience closing month-end books independently



If you do not have UK experience, please do not apply.



Your Role:



You will:



• Support a UK-based Client Manager

• Manage bookkeeping for UK limited companies

• Reconcile bank, Stripe, PayPal and ecommerce platforms for our content creator clients

• Prepare VAT returns (UK and sometimes EU)

• Maintain accurate balance sheets

• Spot and fix errors (not wait to be told)

• Follow structured processes and checklists



You will NOT:



• Only post invoices

• Only do AR/AP

• Only reconcile simple transactions



We need someone who can pick up a messy set of books and make sense of it.



What We’re Looking For



You are:



• Detail-oriented

• Comfortable asking intelligent questions

• Confident working independently

• Able to explain what you’ve done clearly

• Strong with accounting logic (not just data entry)

• Calm under pressure



Bonus if you have worked with:



• Content creators / influencers

• Ecommerce businesses

• Multi-currency clients



Software We Use:



• Xero (essential)

• QBO

• Hubdoc

• Dext

• Slack

• Zoom

• Notion

• Office 365



Experience with Stripe, PayPal, Shopify is a strong advantage.



Working Hours



Full-time remote position.



Typical working hours:

8am – 4pm UK time (GMT/BST)



Reliable high-speed internet required.



You will attend daily or regular Zoom check-ins.





Salary & Benefits



• Competitive salary based on experience

• 13th month pay after probation

• 25 days paid leave per year

• Filipino public holidays honoured

• Long-term stability (we hire for years, not months)



Application Instructions (Important)



To be considered:

 1. Send your CV

 2. Include a short written explanation of:

 • Your UK bookkeeping experience

 • Your experience with UK VAT returns

 3. Include a short Loom video (2–3 minutes) introducing yourself (optional but highly encouraged)



In the subject line of your application write:



“UK Bookkeeper – 3+ Years Xero Experience”



Applications without this exact subject line will not be reviewed.



Recruitment Process

 1. 15-minute Zoom screening

 2. Technical trial task

 3. Final interview

 4. Probation period



We hire carefully and expect high standards.



If you are confident in UK bookkeeping and want long-term stability with a growing firm in an exciting space - we would love to hear from you.

title: Geotechnical Quantity Surveyor - Planswift
description:
We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Geotechnical Quantity Surveyor  to join our team. This is a remote position, perfect for a professional who is passionate about the construction industry. The Estimating Assistant will support our estimating team by preparing take offs. Experience in construction is required, and experience in landscape construction is a plus.



Key Responsibilities:



- Analyze landscape architectural drawings, civil plans, and specifications to identify scope of work.



- Perform accurate quantity takeoffs for materials, labor, and equipment required for landscape construction projects (e.g., planting, hardscapes, irrigation, grading, drainage).



-Clarify unclear details and define scope based on plans and client requirements.



-Coordinate with project managers, estimators, and engineers to ensure a complete understanding of the project scope.



-Provide detailed quantity reports and cost breakdowns to estimating team for bid compilation.



- Assist in pricing materials and labor when needed.



-Ensure all takeoff data is completed within tight bid deadlines and delivered with accuracy



-Utilize takeoff and estimating software (e.g., Bluebeam, PlanSwift, On-Screen Takeoff) efficiently to increase accuracy and productivity.



Requirements:



Geotechnical Quantity Surveyor background is REQUIRED

Fluent in English (written and verbal).

Proven experience in the construction industry (landscape construction experience).

proven experience with Planswift  (REQUIRED)

Ability to work remotely with strong time management and organizational skills.

Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite and construction estimating software.

Excellent communication skills, with attention to detail and accuracy.

Strong ability to multitask and prioritize in a fast-paced environment.



Benefits:



Competitive salary based on experience.

8-5PM US EST time work hours

Opportunities for growth and development within the company.

How to Apply:

Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and why you’d be a great fit for this role to

We look forward to hearing from you!

title: Real Estate Media Virtual Assistant | Long-Term | 5 hrs a day | $5-6/hr
description:
About the Role



We’re hiring a detail-oriented and dependable Real Estate Virtual Assistant to support a growing U.S.-based real estate media company. This is a long-term, part-time role designed for someone who enjoys learning, takes pride in doing things right, and wants to grow into a trusted tea
mber over time.



You’ll start by supporting core media and outreach tasks, with opportunities to take on more responsibility as trust and experience grow. We’re looking for someone who thinks ahead, communicates clearly, and treats the business like it matters, because it does.



This role is ideal for someone who values consistency, has high personal standards, and wants to be part of a team long-term, not just complete tasks and move on.



Your Daily Tasks



- Support real estate media workflows and daily operational tasks

- Assist with social media outreach related to real estate media services

- Help manage and organize files, leads, and communications

- Perform quality checks to ensure accuracy and consistency before delivery

- Maintain clear documentation and organized systems

- Communicate updates, questions, and issues proactively

- Look for small improvements and flag problems early with solutions



Required Qualifications

- Prior experience with real estate media and social media outreach

- Proficient with Photoshop and Lightroom

- Strong attention to detail and accuracy in daily work

- Reliable and consistent availability during 6AM to 11AM CDT hours, 25 hours per week

- Clear written and spoken English communication

- Coachable, curious, and open to feedback

- Strong sense of ownership and accountability

- Professional, trustworthy, and respectful in all interactions

- Comfortable working independently while being a team player



Bonus Skills (Nice to Have)

- Experience working with U.S.-based real estate or media companies

- Familiarity with content, marketing, or client communication workflows

- Experience managing inboxes, DMs, or outreach campaigns

- Comfort learning new tools, systems, or processes quickly



What We Offer

- $5–6 per hour, depending on experience

- Consistent part-time hours with long-term stability

- A role that can grow in responsibility as you prove yourself

- Clear expectations and structured workflows

- A team that values professionalism, trust, and loyalty

- Opportunity to become a key part of a growing company’s journey



How to Apply:



**Please complete all three steps below to be considered:



1 - Submit your resume



2 - Send a short cover letter explaining why you’re a great fit for this role



3 - Record a 1-minute introduction video sharing a bit about yourself, your experience, and why you’re interested



We’re excited to meet someone who’s ready to grow with us, take ownership, and be proud of the work they do every day. If that sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you!

title: Part-Time Demand Generation Marketing Manager (B2B SaaS Content Focus)
description:
Part-Time Demand Generation Manager (B2B SaaS Focus)



Location: Remote (U.S. preferred)

Hours: ~10–15 hrs/week

Reports to: CEO (Daniel Borba)



About SparkPortal



SparkPortal is a Video-as-a-Service partner built for B2B SaaS marketing teams. We help mid-market software companies create scalable, on-brand video content that drives both pipeline and brand trust.



We’re growing fast — and we’re looking for a part-time Demand Generation Manager to help us build and run a repeatable marketing system around webinars, LinkedIn campaigns,
 nurture, and video-led storytelling.



The Role

You’ll work directly with Daniel (Founder & CEO) to turn SparkPortal’s marketing strategy into action. Your mission is to attract and engage SaaS marketing leaders (CMOs, VPs, and Directors) through consistent campaigns that educate, inspire, and generate qualified demand.



Key Responsibilities

Plan and execute quarterly LinkedIn ad campaigns and webinars around key marketing themes (e.g., “The Future of Video,” “LinkedIn Video,” “AI for Video”).



Manage lead capture, nurture, and reporting in HubSpot (or similar CRM).

Support Daniel’s LinkedIn content engine — scheduling ICP interviews, managing post calendars, and tracking performance.

Oversee
 nurture programs and help optimize for conversion and engagement.

title: VIDEO / IMAGE EDITOR (dropshipping)
description:
Department: Content creation Team

Reports To: Process Manager



ROLE



As our Video & Image Editor, you will be responsible for creating and editing ad creatives based on clear guidelines we provide per task. 



You will have to change competition ads into our own by adding flying logo over it, translate and add subtitles to it. These videos are mostly dropshipping video ads in Health and Beauty niche (for example: wart remover, eyelid lifting serum, teeth whitener, etc)





We are looking for an experienced Video & Image Editor who wants to grow with us long term and become a reliable part of our team. This is a hands-on, execution-focused role where consistency, attention to detail, and meeting deadlines are important. While most tasks are guideline-based, there is also room to use your creativity — especially when creating variations from existing high-performing creatives.



RESPONSIBILITIES



Video Editing

• Create video ads according to task-specific guidelines we provide

• Translate video content 

• Create voice-overs using online tools we provide

• Cut, trim, and restructure footage (remove/add scenes as instructed)

• Add elements such as moving logos, text animations, subtitles, and effects

• Ensure videos are correctly formatted and optimized for paid ads



Image Editing

• Create image ads following provided guidelines per task

• Translate text for image ads accurately

• Edit and enhance images using tools such as ChatGPT and Canva

• Create variations by mixing elements from multiple existing high-performing image ads

• Ensure visuals are clean, clear, and optimized for
 & Instagram



Workflow & Execution

• Follow our SOPs step-by-step

• Work according to our KPIs (communicated during the interview)

• Deliver all tasks within agreed deadlines

• Stay flexible and responsive when urgent or extra tasks are needed

• Organize files and exports clearly so creatives are ready for launch



RESULTS



• Deliver high-quality video and image creatives that fully follow our guidelines

• Consistently meet output and deadline expectations

• Maintain a low revision rate by following instructions accurately

• Support fast ad testing by delivering creatives on time

• Improve creative quality over time by applying feedback



REQUIREMENTS (MUST HAVE)



• Proven experience editing video and image ads for eCommerce / dropshipping

• Ability to work strictly according to SOPs and KPIs

• Strong experience with CapCut, Premiere Pro, Canva, and ChatGPT (or similar tools)

• Comfortable working with deadlines and occasional urgent requests

• Strong attention to detail and consistency

• You speak & write English fluently

• Reliable internet connection and consistent availability

title: Content Creator (TikTok, Instagram) with sense of humor and interest in Personal Development
description:
Honestly, all these other job postings here sound reallyy dry and boring :D



Let me try differently.



I don't care about hard skills. I just need someone outgoing and ON FIRE about personal development, who would like to use my App for his/her day-to-day personal development and share the journey online, through all ups and downs :)



That's it.



Your win: Well, the salary, of course.

Your other win: You'll improve in the areas you would like to improve in, personally - 100% guaranteed.

Your other win: You'll learn how to build a personal, authentic brand online. That you may later use for your own business? I'm very happy to help with any experiment of your own.

My win: You become an authentic face of the brand :) Super valuable for growing a community.



THE APP (iPhone only)

I realized that almost everyone would like to grow as a person, but no one REALLY knows how and where to start.

Having lots of experience in this area, I've built the first proper SYSTEM for personal development - so that literally anyone can start easily and doesn't need to buy an expensive Coach.

-> "Identity - Your Growth System" in the App Store, just check it out, it's free. Early user feedback (250 users) has been insane!



The App structures this whole journey, gives lots of guidance and makes tracking super intuitive.



YOUR CONCRETE DELIVERABLES

1 Reel per Day.

We iterate between low-effort reels, medium-effort, and high-effort.

Low-Effort: Static shot, with single-statement on the screen

Medium-Effort: Talking to the camera, sharing some learning/insight/struggle/tips

High-Effort: "Day in the Life" type Reel

-> I built a content engine that spits out a lot of ideas/messages, for the days where you don't have something natural to share



WAYS OF WORKING

No micro-managing at all. We discuss the goals I have for the channel, and you have full creative freedom. I'm always available to assist with sparring ideas or removing blockers. We do a (paid) weekly feedback call, to discuss what is going good and what can be improved from both sides.



WHAT I'M HOPING FOR

The only thing important for me is that you are an outgoing personality, and that you are really passionate about personal growth. Not necessarily that you're already an expert, but that you would LOVE to become one.

Some examples:

- reaching fitness goals (gym, calisthenics, pilates, yoga, core workouts, running, ..)

- happiness and mindfulness (meditation, breathing, journaling, reducing doomscrolling, ..)

- getting a better rhythm (sleeping times, waking times, evening routine, morning routine, ..)

- better social life (meeting friends for coffee, organizing a dinner, calling friends/family, ..)

- learning/curiosity (reading, podcasts, ..)

- creativity (writing, painting, making music, ..)

- purpose (side hustle, volunteering, ..)



IF YOU HAVE READ UNTIL HERE

You're most likely a good candidate, otherwise you wouldn't have remained interested ;)

Begin your application with "LETS HAVE SOME FUN", then a small text (2-5 sentences) explaining why you would love to get this job, and what makes you a good fit. End with "I have an iPhone" (you must be an iPhone user, because the App is iPhone-only).

Feel free to attach any supporting material if you want.



KICKOFF

Two paid trial weeks, for both of us to see whether it's a good fit :)

title: Funnel builder (dropshipping)
description:
ROLE

Build, optimize, and maintain high-converting eCommerce funnels in Funnelish on a daily basis. You’re responsible for a critical part of the sales process — making sure every visitor from our ads lands on a fast, persuasive, and visually appealing funnel. Every funnel follows our proven structure, is mobile-optimized, and leaves no doubt in the customer’s mind about making a purchase.



RESPONSIBILITIES

- Build and customize product pages, upsells, downsells, order bumps, and thank-you pages in Funnelish.

- Implement proven funnel templates and structures based on internal SOPs and competitor research.

- Use persuasion principles (social proof, urgency, scarcity) to drive sales.

- Maintain fast loading speeds and mobile-first design standards.

- Create and edit visual elements for funnels using Canva.

- Work according to set KPI’s for funnel delivery and performance.

- Implement feedback quickly and accurately to improve results.

- Follow SOPs for consistency, scalability, and speed of execution.



RESULTS

- Deliver 2 fully built and optimized funnels per day ready for ad launch.

- Funnels meet or exceed target conversion rates.

- Maintain consistent design quality and brand alignment.

- Continuously improve funnels based on data and feedback.



REQUIREMENTS

- You speak & write English fluently.

- Proven experience with Funnelish and eCommerce/dropshipping funnels.

- Understanding of conversion rate optimization and sales psychology.

- Able to work quickly with drag-and-drop builders while maintaining quality.

- Strong eye for design, layout, and marketing angles.

- Skilled in Canva for creating and adapting visuals.

- Comfortable working with KPI targets and meeting deadlines.

- Able to handle feedback professionally and implement changes quickly.

- Reliable internet connection and a responsive work setup.

title: Prospecting Outbound SDR (Cold Calling) / Lead Generation – Luxury Yachts
description:
About Us



We manage luxury yachts and handle premium client requests daily.



We are looking for a disciplined, fast, and structured Outbound SDR (Cold Calling) to generate qualified interest through outbound calls and pass serious opportunities to our sales team.



This is a structured, process-driven role within a premium environment.



About the Role



You will be making outbound calls to targeted contacts and turning cold outreach into qualified yacht charter inquiries.



Your responsibility is to:



Make outbound calls with a calm, premium tone



Spark interest and identify whether there is real charter intent



Collect essential high-level information 



Keep calls short, controlled, and professional



Write clean, structured notes and prepare a clear handoff summary



Maintain strict organization during your shift





This role requires clarity, control, and discipline, not aggressive selling.



What We Expect



Excellent spoken English (clear, professional, premium tone)



Confidence on the phone and ability to handle rejection calmly



Ability to keep conversations short and controlled



Structured thinking and strong attention to detail



Fast execution and consistency during shift



Comfort following a defined process



Very stable internet and professional working setup (quiet environment + headset; dual screen recommended)



Previous experience in cold calling.



Compensation



$500 per month (to start)



Long-term opportunity with growth potential



Working Style



We value:



Speed



Clean communication



Reliability



Maturity



Process discipline



It’s a structured, premium, and execution-focused role.



How to Apply



Please send:



A short introduction about yourself



Your previous outbound/calling experience



Your internet speed



Your availability (hours per day and days per week)



A 30–60 sec voice note in English (your natural phone tone)



We review applications carefully and only contact shortlisted candidates.

title: Real Estate VA - Inside Sales Agent
description:
Real Estate Virtual Assistant - Full-Time Inside Sales Agent

(Must have prior real estate experience)



Our St. Louis, MO, USA-based Real Estate Investments company, with over a decade in real estate investing, is seeking a dedicated and experienced real estate professional to join our growing team! If you enjoy negotiating deals, have a proven track record in real estate sales, and are looking for a remote opportunity where you can make an impact, please read the details and apply below by reading the how to apply instructions.



Job Description:

We are hiring for the position of Real Estate Inside Sales Agent. In this role, you will work remotely and be responsible for speaking with homeowners, gathering property information, negotiating offers, and securing contracts for our investment properties. Your main focus will be on acquiring distressed properties at favorable terms by getting property info, making offers, negotiating deals, and diligently following up to close sales. You will use your sales expertise and relationship-building skills to engage potential sellers, gather necessary information, and document interactions in our CRM system.



Responsibilities:

- Conduct outbound calls and send
s to manage real estate buying opportunities.

- Make offers to potential sellers and negotiate terms to get our offers accepted.

- Follow up on all leads and negotiations to ensure deal closure.

- Utilize effective sales strategies and scripts to handle objections and convey our company’s value proposition.

- Maintain detailed records of all interactions and negotiations in our CRM system.

- Collaborate with other tea
mbers to ensure seamless transaction processes.



Qualifications:

- High Energy and Enthusiastic Personality: You thrive in a fast-paced, engaging environment.

- 2+ Years of Real Estate Sales and Negotiations Experience: Proven background in closing deals.

- Exceptional English Communication Skills: Fluent in both written and verbal English.

- Fearless Negotiator: Eager to engage in challenging conversations, overcome objections, and secure agreements.

- Organized and Detail-Oriented: Excellent time management skills.

- Technologically Proficient: Experience using CRM systems and quick to learn new technologies.

- Problem Solver: Ability to navigate complex negotiations effectively.



System Requirements:

- Reliable high-speed laptop or desktop computer.

- DSL Internet connection with a minimum speed of 40+ Mbps.

- Noise-canceling headset.

- Must have a dedicated quiet home office setup



Performance Metrics:

- Talk to a certain number of sellers daily, weekly, and monthly.

- Achieve a target number of accepted offers each month.

- Consistently follow up to close deals within expected timeframes.



Career Growth & Training:

- Opportunities for advancement into leadership roles for high-performing individuals.

- Professional training provided to enhance your skills.



Company Culture:

- Dynamic and Collaborative: We value teamwork, integrity, and a drive for excellence.

- Supportive Environment: We believe in ongoing professional growth and celebrating achievements.

- High Ethical Standards: We conduct business with honesty and transparency.



What We’re Looking For:

- Self-motivated professionals with a positive attitude.

- Candidates with a dedicated home office setup.

- Ability to thrive in a remote role with excellent time management skills.

- Experience in real estate sales



What We’re Not Looking For:

- Candidates who cannot commit to our specified working hours: Monday to Friday, 9 AM - 6 PM CST.

- Minimal Communication Skills: If you struggle with fluent English communication, both written and verbal.

- Lack of Self-Motivation and Enthusiasm.

- Candidates unfamiliar with CRMs and resistant to learning new systems or scripts.

- Candidates with inconsistent internet and power supply or a disruptive workspace.

- Candidates who are easily flustered, shy, or fearful when making calls.

- Offline or Non-Voice Preference: This is a phone-based sales position.



Pay Rate:

Starting up to $6/hr, with performance bonuses. Pay is issued on the 1st and 15th of each month (CST).



Working Hours:

Monday to Friday, 9 AM - 6 PM CST. A 30-minute lunch break and two 15-minute breaks per shift.



How to Apply: (Submit Your Resume and Introduction)

-
 your updated resume and a brief personalized audio or video recording to: 

- Use the subject line "Real Estate Application - Inside Sales Agent"

- In your recording, introduce yourself and explain why you are a great fit for this role.

- Attach a recent internet speed test result and a photo of your home office setup to verify your system readiness.



= Important Note: Only complete applications that follow all the instructions will be considered. We look forward to reviewing your application! =

title: Amazon Brand Manager & Brand Manager Intern
description:
AMAZON BRAND MANAGER



We are looking for a talented and versatile Amazon Brand Manager! If you think that you have what it takes to be successful in this role, we welcome you to apply!



Do you like going from one meeting to another with non-stop action and solving problems every day while managing 8 people? Where you are trying to please clients and juggling tons of competing priorities? If so, this is the job for you.



Brand Managers own the relationships at our agency. It’s your job to make customers like us while delivering our team’s accurate non-stop activities.



Responsibilities:

- Manage clients' accounts assigned. The Brand Manager will act as the direct point of contact for the client, responsible for coordinating MAGs services, implementing strategy, communicating with clients, direct reports, and leadership.

- 2+ Direct Reports. In addition to client services, this position is also a managerial position, and following the completion of training, brand managers will be expected to lead a small team of Amazon specialists, who will assist the manager with delivering MAG services to the client.

- Brand managers are the company's backbone, directly responsible for our client accounts.

- Proactively provide a strategy for the account, communicate with the client, and ensure MAG process and deliverables are met.

- Delegate tasks properly to your direct reports and the MAG teams, follow up on delegations, hold staff accountable, and report back to the client.



Qualifications:

- Amazon Expertise: 1+ year with Seller Central (flat files, FBA, PPC, SEO, reinstatements, brand registry, Helium10, keyword research).

- Agency & Management: Experience handling multiple demands, leading teams, hiring, and performance management.

- Project & Client Management: Skilled in multitasking, project management, client communication, and account ownership.

- Tech-Savvy: Comfortable with tools like Zoom, Slack, Asana, and adapting in fast-changing environments.

- Passion for eCommerce: Independent, people-focused, and driven to grow client sales on Amazon.



Expectations:

- Competitive salary!

- Fun Fully Remote Culture – Community Culture, Team Oriented Environment

- You can have your OWN Amazon selling business and utilize company resources to build your own account! We love and ? encourage entrepreneurs, in fact, the majority of employees have their own selling accounts!

- Unlimited Learning and Growth – If you meet and exceed our core values and grow sales, you will have unlimited opportunities to grow, advance, promote, and earn more.

- 40 hours a week, 8 hours a day

- Permanent WFH setup

- The work schedule is in Eastern Standard Time (Monday to Friday only)

- A dual-monitor setup is required (at least 8GB of RAM)

- Good quality camera and microphone

- Must have at least 25 MBPS internet speed

- Must consistently maintain good performance and seek skills development for professional growth.





------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------





AMAZON BRAND MANAGER INTERN



Want to catapult out of that “Walmart uniform” and into a world of digital marketing?



We're hiring a Brand Manager Intern at our agency. If you're a tech-savvy gamer who thrives amidst organized chaos, then you are the one that we are looking for!



We will train you how to manage people effectively, communicate better with clients, and navigate tools such as Slack smoothly, while you work at home on your computer. You also get to learn how to sell on Amazon which is the number 1 wealth generation platform in the USA for beginners.



Here's what you'd be doing with us:

- Mastermind core services like PPC, SEO, Design, Catalog merchandising, and troubleshoot like a pro.

- Take charge of at least 8-10 accounts in Seller Central Accounts under a Brand Manager.

- Be the communication bridge between clients and our agency.

- Train and mentor at least 2 AS Intern/BM Intern.



Yes, it's challenging. Yes, it's exciting. Yes, it could be the start of your new career!



We will train you on everything. MAG is an education company and we find it’s easier to find the right culture fit and then train the skills than the other way around.



We're looking for:

- High Drive

- Friendly Introverts

- Strategic Communication Skills

- Ability to take charge, and follow through on a plan



So what are you waiting for? Toss away that nametag and make the switch today.



Expectations:

- 40 hours a week, 8 hours a day

- You work on your own computer and dual monitors

- Must have at least 25 MBPS internet speed

- Know how to use basic Google Sheets and Excel functions



You’ve got the talent—we’ve got the opportunity. Take control of your career and apply now!



For any questions or follow-ups,
 us at

title: UI/UX Web Designer
description:
We are seeking a talented and creative UI/UX Web Designer with a strong background in visual design and user experience. The ideal candidate will be responsible for creating intuitive and engaging user interfaces for our web applications and platforms. 



Key Responsibilities:

- Wire framing and Prototyping: Create wireframes, prototypes, and mockups to visualize design concepts and user flows, ensuring that the design meets user needs and business goals.

- User Research: Conduct user research and usability testing to gather insights and validate design concepts, ensuring that user needs are met.

- Collaboration: Work closely with product managers, developers, and other stakeholders to design user-centered solutions that enhance the overall user experience..

- Visual Design: Develop the visual aspects of the website, including color schemes, typography, and layout, to create an aesthetically pleasing and cohesive user interface.

- Interaction Design: Designing interactive elements of the website, such as buttons, forms, and navigation, to enhance user engagement and improve usability.

- Usability Testing: Conducting usability tests to gather feedback on design prototypes and making iterative improvements based on user feedback.

- Responsive Design: Ensuring that the website is responsive and provides a seamless experience across various devices and screen sizes.

- Feedback Incorporation: Iterate designs based on user feedback and analytics to continuously improve the user experience.

- Documentation: Create and maintain design documentation, style guides, and design systems to ensure consistency across all products.

- Stay Current: Keeping abreast of industry trends, tools, and best practices in UI/UX design to continuously improve skills and design quality.



Qualifications:

- Minimum of 2+ years of experience in UI/UX design roles, ideally with a focus on web applications or websites.

- A degree in Graphic Design, Web Design, Human-Computer Interaction, or a related field.

- Certifications in UI/UX design or related disciplines can be beneficial.

- Strong portfolio showcasing design projects that highlight your problem-solving skills and creativity in UI/UX design.

- Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Adobe Creative Suite, Sketch, Figma, or similar software.

- Understanding of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript to effectively communicate with developers.

- Experience in conducting user research, usability testing, and gathering user feedback to inform design decisions.

- Solid understanding of user-centered design principles and methodologies.

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present and explain design concepts to various stakeholders.

- Ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously.



What We Offer:

- Competitive salary base

- Permanent remote setup

- Unlimited free access to MAG School courses and SOP Library

- Opportunities for professional development and career advancement



Why wait for permission to level up? Apply now and step into a role where your skills are truly valued.



Follow up anytime at

?

title: Ecom Performance Video Editor | High-Growth | Long-Term
description:
## Role Overview



The purpose of the Video Editor role at Ivy Ecommerce is to transform creative briefs into high-performing video ads that drive conversions at scale.



This is not just a technical editing role.



Our Video Editors are an integral part of the marketing engine. Your job is to understand the psychology, messaging, and strategy behind each ad concept, and bring it to life through sharp editing, pacing, storytelling, and attention to detail.



As a Video Editor, you are responsible for the execution and final polish of our video ads. The success of our marketing team depends on your ability to:



- Understand each creative brief from a performance/direct-response marketing lens

- Assemble visuals, hooks, captions, and pacing in a way that maximizes conversions

- Enhance the core marketing message through smart creative decisions



You understand that small details can be the difference between an ad that gets scaled to millions in spend and one that dies after testing.



Your role is to work closely with our Creative Strategists, actively learn what makes ads win or lose, and help us consistently produce winning ads month over month across our brand portfolio.





### Primary Responsibilities



- Edit and deliver ~10 ad briefs per week

- Collaborate closely with Creative Strategists to ensure each ad concept is executed correctly

- Implement feedback from the creative team and performance data to improve iterations

- Learn and internalize our ad strategy frameworks to understand what makes creatives “win” or “lose”

- Analyze your own creatives to identify what’s working, what isn’t, and how to improve

- Upload and organize final assets into the correct folders and formats for each platform





## Qualifications



### Direct Experience



- 1+ year experience editing eCommerce / performance marketing ads

- Experience working within a team environment and understanding roles in a creative workflow





### Character Traits We Look For



- Extremely high attention to detail – you care about the small things because you know they matter

- Creative + marketing-minded – you’re not just an editor, you’re curious about why ads perform

- Strong visual communicator and storyteller

- High curiosity and a desire to continuously improve your creative and marketing skills

- Willingness to do the “boring but important” work consistently at a high standard

- Clear communicator who collaborates well with a team

- Time-efficient, but willing to put in extra effort when quality demands it

- Hungry, motivated, and growth-oriented – you want to get better, take on more responsibility, and level up your career

- to make sure you are still reading, type “BLUE” in your response title.

- Coachable and open to feedback

- Not a clock-in, clock-out mindset — you care about results and impact







### This Role Is NOT for You If:



- You only want to execute tasks without understanding the marketing behind them

- You’re not interested in learning performance marketing or creative strategy

- You dislike feedback or fast-paced environments

- You’re disorganized or unreliable

- You prefer working solo and don’t enjoy team collaboration

- You’re not motivated to grow your skills and career over time







### Growth & Upside



At Ivy Ecommerce, we invest in people who perform and show initiative. This role has real upside for those who take ownership:



- Opportunity to grow into a Creative Strategist / Creative Lead role over time

- Increased responsibility across multiple brands in our portfolio

- Performance-based bonuses tied to ad spend (no cap)

- Long-term growth path into higher-level marketing and creative leadership roles



This is a long-term opportunity for someone who wants to build a career in performance marketing, creative & be part of building cool ecom brands, not just edit videos.







## ???? How to Apply



To be considered, please reply with:



- A short overview of yourself

- Your CV / Resume with your past work experience

- Your eCommerce video editing portfolio

- Your
 address + WhatsApp number



Then answer the questions below in detail:



1. What about this role excites you most?

2. Why do you believe you’re a strong fit for this role?







Applications that do not follow these instructions or provide detailed answers will not be reviewed.

title: AI Image Prompt Specialist - Realistic Human Fashion (Simulated Clothing Shoots)
description:
We’re looking for a highly detail-oriented AI Image Prompt Specialist to generate realistic human fashion images for simulated clothing shoots (e-commerce style). Your job is to consistently produce outputs that look like real photos that are not “AI-looking” and to refine prompts until results meet our realism and brand standards.



You’ll be trained on our realism rules (how to avoid common AI artifacts and unrealistic outputs). But you must already be excellent at prompt writing, iterative refinement, and visual QA.



What You’ll Do



- Generate realistic human model images for clothing/product presentations (studio + lifestyle concepts)

- Write and refine prompts to:



- Keep humans anatomically correct (hands, faces, body proportions, posture)

- Ensure realistic fabric behavior (drape, folds, seams, tension points, thickness)

- Maintain clean product visibility (logos, prints, stitching, garment shape)

- Match lighting, camera lens feel, and consistent “photoshoot” aesthetics

- Run multiple iterations quickly, compare outputs, and select the best

- Apply consistent standards for realism and brand look

- Track prompt versions and what changed (so we can improve repeatability)

- Follow internal guidelines to reduce AI artifacts and “uncanny” results



Requirements (Must-Have)



- Proven experience generating photorealistic AI images of humans

- Strong prompt engineering skills: composition, lighting, camera settings, styling, negative prompts, refinement loops

- Sharp eye for detail and realism (you notice small issues quickly)

- Able to match a reference style and keep outputs consistent

- Excellent English comprehension for instructions and feedback

- Reliable communication + ability to deliver daily/weekly output targets



Nice-to-Have



- Fashion/e-commerce/photography background (styling, lighting, posing, editorial vs product shooting)

- Experience with consistent character/model workflows

- Experience building “prompt recipes” / reusable prompt frameworks

- Basic understanding of garment construction (seams, collars, cuffs, hems)



How We’ll Work



We’ll provide:

- Clothing references / creative direction

- Our realism checklist + training on what to avoid

- Feedback loops to improve consistency



You deliver:

- A set of usable images per product/concept

- The prompts used + notes on what you changed between iterations



To Apply Please include:

1. Your portfolio/examples (especially realistic humans + fashion)

2. The AI tools/workflows you use (and why)

3. A short note: your process for fixing common realism issues (hands, faces, fabric, lighting)

4. Your availability + expected hourly rate



If you’re the kind of person who can make AI images look like they came from a real camera and you’re obsessive about realism we want to work with you.
