title: Expert Cold Calling
description:
Company: MRG

Location: Remote

Hours: Full-Time or Part-Time (EST Time Zone Preferred)



About Us:

 MRG is a fast-growing real estate brokerage serving Connecticut and New York. We are building a high-performance team focused on consistent lead generation, strong follow-up, and delivering top-level service to buyers, sellers, and property owners.



We are looking for a driven and detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support our team with outbound calling to expired listings and property management administrative tasks.



Primary Responsibilities:



1. Expired Listing Prospecting



Call expired, withdrawn, and FSBO listings daily



Follow provided scripts and objection-handling dialogues



Build rapport and gather motivation



Set listing appointments for the broker or agents



Log all calls and notes in CRM



Follow up with leads consistently



2. Property Management Support



Respond to tenant inquiries 
/text templates provided)



Schedule maintenance requests



Coordinate with vendors and track completion



Assist with rent tracking and reporting



Update property management software



Prepare basic reports for the broker



3. Administrative Support



CRM data entry and tagging



 follow-up campaigns



Calendar management



Basic document preparation



Social media posting (optional bonus skill)



Requirements:



Prior real estate experience preferred (especially calling expired listings)



Strong English communication skills



Confident on the phone



Experience with CRM systems (Follow Up Boss, kvCORE, or similar)



Organized and detail-oriented



Ability to handle objections professionally



Comfortable making 80–120 calls per day



Stable internet and quiet work environment



Performance Expectations:



Minimum 3–5 listing appointments set per week (after training period)



Daily call report submitted



100+ outbound dials per day (if full-time calling role)



Property management tasks completed within 24 hours



Compensation:



Hourly rate (based on experience)



Performance bonus for appointments set and listings taken



Growth opportunity into Lead ISA or Operations Manager role



Ideal Candidate Traits:



Resilient (doesn’t get emotionally affected by rejection)



Positive and coachable



Self-starter



Long-term mindset



Interested in growing within a real estate company



Please send me your recording :

Virtual Assistant Recording Audition Script



“Hi, is this Mr./Ms. [Seller’s Last Name]?



Hi, this is [Their Name] calling on behalf of Tony with MRG. I know your home recently came off the market, and I’m sure you’ve been getting a lot of calls.



The reason for my call is simple — Tony specializes in helping homeowners whose properties didn’t sell the first time around. He wanted to see if you’re still open to selling, or if you’ve d
 to take a break for now?



(Pause as if listening.)



That makes sense. Just out of curiosity, what do you think stopped the home from selling the first time?



(Pause.)



Got it. If there were a strategy that could help you get the home sold in this market, would you at least be open to a quick 15-minute conversation to explore your options?



Tony has availability this week. Would afternoons or evenings work better for you?”

title: Cold Calling - BASE PAY + BONUSES
description:
We are a roofing company based in the US that is expanding its already proven call center.



EXTRA PER HOUR + BONUSES FOR PERFORMANCE

Based pay is $3/hour and increases based on performance every pay period (2 weeks).

2+ sales will result in $4/hour for that pay period, 4+ sales will result in $5/hour in that pay period.

PLUS $25 BONUS per sale made. 



The average dialer should be prepared to make 2+ sales a week and be in the $4/hour and $50+ on a regular basis. 

Hard workers can expect to regularly make it to the $5/hour and $100+.



* Hours: 40 hrs/week, Monday–Fri 11 AM – 8 PM CST. These are 8 hours days with a 1 hour unpaid lunch break.

For those that want 40+ a week, 9AM - 6PM CST on Saturdays is highly encouraged, but not required.



Requirements:

Excellent English fluency + perfect American accent

Must have 1+ years experience in cold calling experience, preferably in the US roofing, real estate, or solar industry.



APPLICANTS THAT DO NOT MEET THESE REQUIREMENTS WILL NOT BE INTERVIEWED.

Respond to this application with a 30 second video of yourself explaining your experience in the cold calling industry and which mornings you are available for an interview.



-Graham

Roofing Solutions

description:

This is not a basic editing role. We need someone who thinks like a marketer.



???? What You’ll Be Doing



• Editing high converting direct response ads for Meta

• Creating multiple hook variations from the same raw footage

• Repurposing UGC, testimonials, talking heads, and product shots

• Testing different angles: pain points, benefits, authority, curiosity, education

• Iterating fast based on performance data

• Working closely with our media buyer and creative strategist



Our model is subscription based, so retention matters. Your creatives should attract the right customers, not just cheap clicks.



???? What We’re Looking For



• Proven experience editing supplement or health product ads

• Strong understanding of Meta ad structure (hook ? problem ? solution ? proof ? CTA)

• Fast turnaround and organized workflow

• Creative thinker who brings ideas, not just execution

• Experience working with UGC style content



Bonus if you understand:

• Longevity supplements

• NMN, NAD+, anti aging positioning

• Subscription funnel dynamics



???? This Is Performance Focused



We care about:

• Hook rate

• Hold rate

• Thumb stop ratio

• Conversion rate



If you have winning ads you’ve worked on, share them. We want to see results, not just pretty edits.



???? What We Offer



• Long term opportunity

• Consistent workload

• Room to grow with the brand

• Direct collaboration with founders

• Performance based upside potential



???? To Apply



Please send:

1. Your portfolio (especially supplement ads)

2. 2 to 3 winning Meta ads you’ve worked on

3. Brief explanation of why you think they performed well

4. Your rate and availability



If you understand both creative and conversion psychology, we want to talk.



Let’s build something meaningful in the longevity space.

title: Medical Front Desk & Administrative Coordinator (Medical Insurance)
description:
Job Title: Virtual Medical Front Desk & Administrative Coordinator



Work Setup: Remote | Full-Time | Healthcare Setting



Job Overview



We are seeking a highly organized and detail-oriented Virtual Medical Front Desk & Administrative Coordinator to support daily clinic operations. This role is responsible for managing patient communication, scheduling, insurance verification, documentation review, and administrative follow-ups to ensure smooth and compliant workflow within the practice.



This position is ideal for someone who is proactive, structured, and comfortable handling both patient-facing communication and backend administrative processes.



Key Responsibilities



Patient Communication & Scheduling



Answer incoming phone calls and respond to voi
s promptly



Respond to customer and patient
s in a professional manner



Schedule new and existing patients by phone as needed



Set up new referrals in the electronic medical record (EMR)



Insurance & Authorization Verification



Verify insurance benefits using the EMR system (e.g., pVerify) or coordinate with the billing team (e.g., Bonfire Revenue chat)



Confirm correct visit types (Follow-Up, Progress Note, POC Update, etc.)



Verify updated authorizations and determine when Auth Visits are required



Chart Review & Compliance



Review next-day schedules to ensure all intakes and surveys are sent and completed



Audit new patient charts to confirm required documentation is complete



Follow up on missing chart components (referrals, insurance, forms, etc.)



Add detailed notes on patient visits regarding outstanding requirements (copays, balances, missing documents, referrals, etc.)



Collections & Financial Follow-Up



Review missed copay reports daily



Collect outstanding copays or document notes for future collection



Identify and follow up on patient balances



Documentation & Filing



Electronically file incoming faxes



Upload and organize scanned documents in the EMR system



Maintain accurate and organized digital records



Additional Duties



Perform comparable administrative tasks as needed to support clinic operations



Qualifications



Previous experience in medical front desk, healthcare administration, or insurance verification preferred



Strong understanding of EMR systems and documentation workflows



Familiarity with insurance verification and authorizations



Excellent verbal and written communication skills



Highly organized with strong attention to detail



Ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively



Reliable internet connection and quiet remote workspace required



Ideal Candidate



Proactive and solution-oriented



Comfortable working independently in a remote environment



Detail-focused with strong follow-up habits



Patient-centered and professional in all communications



This role is essential to maintaining operational efficiency, compliance, and a positive patient experience within the clinic.

description:
HOW TO APPLY

If this opportunity feels like the perfect fit for you and you meet the job qualifications, we invite you to learn more about our HiEnd Accents team in the Philippines and submit your application here: 
/appzq4iqeIREQRVyo/pagHKo8CnRtRpX585/form



Please note: Only applications submitted via this link will be considered.



Job Description



We are looking for an experienced, passionate, and creative Social Media Manager to join our team! As our Social Media Manager, you will be responsible for implementing our Social Media strategy in order to increase our online presence and strengthen our relationship with our customers and fans. You will be working closely with our Senior Social Media Manager and the remainder of our Marketing department. The platforms that you’ll primarily work on and be responsible for are (1) Instagram, (2)
, and (3) Pinterest. As our Social Media Manager, you will have a meaningful impact on our growth, bottom line, and brand identity in an exciting, design-driven company where being creative is just as important as being analytical.



The ideal candidate excels in building relationships, is passionate about social media and interior design, is a strong writer with a keen visual eye, and thrives on performance-driven teams.



We are looking for a long-term tea
mber who will stay and grow at our company. We offer competitive compensation, a good and stable work environment, and plenty of growth opportunities.



PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES



Content Development:



- In partnership with our Senior Social Media Manager and Marketing Team, create and maintain a social media content calendar that supports primary brand stories and goals while also tapping into seasonal 
nts and appropriate trends

- Create original, on-brand social media content that our followers will appreciate

- Content will be a mix of product-related content as well as product-adjacent content (e.g., top sleep tips!)

- Leveraging data, identify UGC and inspiration imagery to be considered for posting

- Write effective content. Work with copywriters and designers to ensure content is informative and appealing

- Keep up to date with current news, pausing content and escalating to leadership where appropriate

- Partner with Marketing and eComm tea
mbers to create shot lists for social media, as needed

- Develop Instagram Stories templates and stickers. Using those templates and Instagram platform elements, create our Instagram Stories



Posting:



- Schedule content for
, Instagram feed, Instagram Stories, and Pinterest, either within the app or by using tools such as Sprout Social or Later

- Post Instagram Stories directly from the Instagram app



Affiliate Marketing & Community Management



- Respond to all engagement and direct messages within 24 hours on weekdays

- Respond to all urgent engagement and direct messages within 24 hours on weekends

- Respond to engagement during normal US hours (range of acceptable times: 10 pm PH - 9 am PH)

- Author thoughtful, individualized comments and messages in the brand voice in response to comments on our pages, on images where we are tagged or where our product is depicted, and on images posted by brands and people we admire!

- Develop and maintain a live document with common questions and responses

- Adhere to rules and regulations - **no “black hat” social media techniques**! We want to build our brand presence organically



Asset Collection



- Request and gather UGC from our followers and fans in our Airtable database. Request content usage permission for all images that are within our brand guidelines. Follow up via
 or direct message as needed for any assets we are especially eager to share.

- Obtain or verify permissions for any images submitted via direct message,
, influencer collaborations or other means and upload to our visual curation tool, editing beforehand as needed.

- With brand priorities in mind, investigate content leads identified by social media, press, and other means to create a library of aspirational imagery featuring our products



Influencer Marketing



- Identify influencers who we can work with as part of our influencer marketing strategy

- Execute on influencer marketing strategy and management, including cultivating our network of valued influencer partners



Reporting & Strategy



- Assist in regular content performance and competitive reporting and analysis

- Provide ad hoc qualitative social analysis

- Be our in-house expert on social platform updates and trends in social media, interior design, home, and retail, presenting out to the team as needed

- Continuously seek ways to improve processes, recommending any tools or technology needed and subsequently serving as the primary point of contact for the relevant third parties

- Ideate new social activations, such as content series, engagement strategies, contests, and giveaways



About HiEnd Accents



HiEnd Accents designs and creates everyday luxury bedding and linens, sheeting, decorative pillows and other home textiles. Founded in 2005 and based in Dallas, Texas, our mission is to elevate our customers' lives via beautifully designed home textiles that deliver quality and value.



As a family-owned business, we’re committed to personal service and long-term relationships. Through our four brands, we offer unique designs across a spectrum of styles and price points, all united by exceptional value. Combined with our customer-first approach, prompt shipping and low order minimums, we’ve become the preferred bedding supplier for thousands of top department stores, furniture retailers, interior designers, and boutique hotels nationwide. Recently recognized on the 2024 INC 5000 list as one of the fastest-growing businesses in the US, we continue to innovate and expand our reach in the home textiles market.



Discover more about us and our brands at 



Why HiEnd Accents?



At HiEnd Accents, we're a close-knit team driven by entrepreneurial spirit, growth mindset, and a shared commitment to excellence. Our collaborative approach has propelled us to new heights – we're proud to be recognized on the 2024 INC 5000 list as one of the fastest-growing small companies in the United States. This achievement is a testament to our team's dedication and the exciting opportunities ahead. If you thrive in a vibrant, high-paced culture where your contributions truly matter, we want to hear from you!



Working at HiEnd Accents means that you can expect the following:



-Competitive Compensation - We offer a highly competitive compensation package, including 13th Month Pay

-Professional Growth - We invest in our people and make sure that they have the opportunity to learn, grow and develop their careers continuously

-Great Team of Like-Minded Professionals - We prioritize hiring based on culture and values, so you’re working with a team of folks who are as fun, talented, and committed as you are

title: HighLevel (GHL) Technical Support & Reporting VA
description:
Full-Time | Long-Term | Growth Role | Remote



We are a fast-growing UK fitness franchise using GoHighLevel to run lead management, booking, messaging, and automations across 25+ locations.



We are looking for a technically strong Virtual Assistant who can own our GoHighLevel systems and reporting and support franchisees day to day.



This is not a generic VA role. You will be working inside live production systems that affect lead flow, bookings, and revenue across a real franchise network.



At Transform Hub, we care about people, and that extends to the people who work for us.



This is a chance to work alongside the Head of Tech and the CEO of a booming fitness franchise. You will learn about and get a chance to use emerging technology and use GHL for far more than a standard business or marketing agency.





Core Outcome



You are responsible for keeping our GoHighLevel systems and Google Sheets reporting accurate, live, and trusted across the entire franchise network.



If a franchisee or leader asks, “What’s happening with my leads and sales this week?”, we should be able to answer using dashboards and reports that you maintain.



This Is Not a Junior Role



We are not looking for someone who is still learning GoHighLevel.



You must already have hands-on experience managing live GoHighLevel accounts, diagnosing problems independently, and working in systems where mistakes affect real businesses.



Do not apply if:



- You have not used GoHighLevel in a live production environment

- You cannot work UK hours (9am–5pm GMT/BST), Monday to Friday

- You rely on snapshot cloning without understanding how the systems actually work

- You are uncomfortable troubleshooting problems you have not seen before



Hours & Setup



- Full-time: 40 hours per week



- UK hours: 9am–5pm GMT/BST, Monday to Friday



- Not an async role - you’ll work live alongside the UK team



- Daily 10-minute Zoom check-in



- Ongoing communication via Slack



What You Will Be Doing



Priority 0 – Reporting & Data Hygiene (Daily / Weekly)



This is the foundation of the role. You keep our numbers clean so decisions are based on reality, not guesses.



Examples:



Check that all key metrics are flowing correctly from GoHighLevel into Google Sheets / dashboards (leads, booked calls, show-ups, sales, cancels, churn).



Manually update or correct data when automations miss something (fixing stages, tags, sources, owners, etc.).



Run daily and weekly “sanity checks” to spot problems early (e.g. a site suddenly shows 0 leads today, pipeline totals look wrong, a formula is broken).



Maintain clear, documented definitions for every KPI so reporting is consistent across all locations.



Prepare simple weekly summary reports for leadership and franchisees.

Work with tools like 
 (we can train you) to keep reporting flows reliable.



Priority 1 – Franchisee Support & Troubleshooting (Daily)



You are the first point of contact when something breaks or looks wrong.



Real examples:

A franchisee reports that automated follow-up messages have stopped sending.

The AI booking bot is not adding appointments to the correct calendar.

Leads are receiving duplicate or overlapping automated messages even after staff have replied.

Booking confirmations are going out with the wrong location or coach name.

A workflow that was working last week has silently broken.



You will:



Check workflow execution logs and trigger conditions.

Reproduce the problem in a controlled way.

Find the root cause, not just describe the symptom.

Test your fix safely before pushing it live.



Priority 2 – Workflow & Automation Management (Regular)



Create and edit workflows and automations.

Manage pipelines, stages, and opportunity flows.

Build and maintain forms, surveys, calendars, and basic landing pages.

Set up and edit SMS,
, and WhatsApp templates.

Manage contacts and bulk actions carefully (no “oops, I messaged 10,000 people by mistake”).



Priority 3 – Account Setup & Systems (As Needed)



Set up new franchise sub-accounts from snapshots.

Manage snapshots and sub-account configurations.

Handle basic webhook setup inside GoHighLevel.

Liaise with GoHighLevel support when needed and follow through to resolution.



Tools You Will Use



GoHighLevel (core of the role – required)

Google Sheets (daily for reporting and checks)

Slack (team communication)

Canva (basic asset tweaks)

GHL calendars and booking systems

AI tools (e.g. ChatGPT) to speed up your work without reducing quality

Bonus: 
 and CloseBot experience



The Type of Person We Want



This matters more than your tool list.



Green Flags



- You check workflow execution history before asking what went wrong.

- You test a fix in a controlled way before pushing it live.

- You proactively flag issues you spot before anyone reports them.

- You explain why something broke, not just what you changed.

- You are comfortable saying, “I need to check this before I change anything.”

- You notice when numbers don’t look right in a report and go dig.



Red Flags



- You guess or change settings without understanding the impact.

- You say “done” without testing.

- You need to be told what to look at every time something breaks.

- You avoid taking ownership when something goes wrong.

- You are not available during UK working hours.



Experience Required



Proven experience using GoHighLevel in a live, production environment.

Experience supporting multiple accounts or locations is strongly preferred.

Strong Google Sheets skills (lookups, filters, pivots, error checking).

Comfortable learning new tools and adapting to evolving systems.

Detail-oriented, reliable, and calm when things break.

Strong written English – you will communicate directly with franchisees (business owners, not tech people).



Compensation



$1,200–$1,500 USD per month, depending on experience

Performance-based increases

Long-term role with room to grow for the right person



Hiring Process & How To Apply



Written Application

In your application, please include:





- A short summary of your GoHighLevel experience (what you actually did, not just “used it”).

- A link to a Google Sheet dashboard or report you have built or maintained. Briefly explain how you kept the data accurate (3–5 sentences).

- A short description of a time when the numbers in a report didn’t make sense. How did you find the root cause and fix it?

- Short Loom Video (2–3 minutes)





Introduce yourself.



Walk through the Google Sheet/report you shared and explain how you use it.



Tell us about the most complex GoHighLevel problem you have fixed.



We will then proceed to a 1-on-1 Interview with shortlisted candidates.





Afterwards, we will make a final decision.





If you want a fun role where your technical brain, attention to detail, and calm problem-solving directly impact dozens of real businesses every day, we’d like to see your application.

title: Order Management Specialist
description:
TO APPLY

If this opportunity feels like the perfect fit for you and you meet the job qualifications, we invite you to learn more about our HiEnd Accents team in the Philippines and submit your application here:


/appzq4iqeIREQRVyo/pagZk1jvydfqYXGy9/form



Applications submitted through onlinejobs.ph will not be reviewed. We look forward to reviewing your application.



TO BE RESPECTFUL OF YOUR TIME, PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DO NOT MEET THE JOB REQUIREMENTS. We evaluate against these requirements strictly. If you do not have the requisite experience, please do not apply.



JOB DESCRIPTION



We are looking for an energetic and detail-oriented individual with extensive experience managing customer order flow to join our growing team. As an Order Management Specialist, you will be responsible for processing customer orders and coordinating fulfillment logistics. The ultimate goal is to ensure that customer orders are processed efficiently, accurately and on-time.



As an Order Management Specialist, you will work as a member of our company’s Operations team. To be successful at the role, the ideal candidate must have strong customer service, communication and interpersonal skills. You will work closely with our internal team and our customers (via
 and phone) to fulfill their orders. You can expect to learn a lot about how our business functions, be professionally challenged and have plenty of opportunities for career development!



We are looking for long-term tea
mbers who will stay and grow at our company! Please apply if you have full-time availability and can commit to a long-term, mutually beneficial role.



WHAT YOU'LL DO

- Bring in customer orders daily from various sources, including customer portals, EDI,
s and faxes

- Respond to incoming
s and phone calls with same-day service

- Confirm purchase order changes and make changes to orders in our ERP system

- Maintain accurate documentation of all actions/conversations/issues (through Front and Airtable)

- Release orders/backorders for shipping in a timely fashion

- Organize order releasing for easy picking and communicate with our Warehouse team for shipment alignment

- Create delivery slips and invoice shipped orders

- Upload/enter shipping and invoicing information to customer portals

- Create, send inventory, shipping and invoicing EDI documents

- Handle payment issues, solve order-related problems and interact with account managers as needed

- Interact with customers and provide them with information on order-related questions (such as inventory availability) and product inquiries

- Understand and ensure departmental KPIs, objectives, and guidelines are followed

- Ensure customer SLAs are followed

- Work on other duties as assigned



WHO YOU ARE

- A Bachelor's Degree

- 1-3 years experience with order management, data entry and customer service

- Excellent verbal and written communication skills; additionally, strong interpersonal skills, particularly in a customer-facing capacity

- EDI experience

- Excellent attention to detail

- Strong organizational skills; self-motivated and proactive

- MS Excel ability

- Excellent English skills

- Ability to work with our US team via
, Slack and Zoom. Highly preferred, but not required: experience with Airtable and Notion

- Positive, kind and easy to work with

- A team player mentality - one team, one dream!

- Positive and kind

- A desire to learn and grow within our organization

- Willingness to learn and adopt new tools

- Reliable and detailed-oriented

- Stable, trustworthy highly dependable. Ideally someone seeking a long-term relationship where we can both grow from the relationship



HOURS

Fixed Schedule, M-F, US Central Time



ABOUT HIEND ACCENTS

HiEnd Accents creates designer bedding and home decor. Founded by a husband-wife team in 2005, we remain a family business today. Our customers love our unique designs across a wide range of styles, everyday luxury pricing and commitment to excellent service. We sell on both a wholesale as well as retail basis and are based in Irving, TX.



WHY HIEND ACCENTS?

Our small size and fast-paced culture reward people who act and think like owners. If you're someone who has a growth mentality, strives for exceptionalism, are a committed professional and a straight shooter, you’ll fit in with our culture and go far with our company.



Working at HiEnd Accents means that you can expect the following:

- Competitive Compensation - We offer a highly competitive compensation package, including 13th Month Pay

- Professional Growth - We invest in our people and make sure that they have the opportunity to continuously learn, grow and develop their careers

- Great Team of Like-Minded Professionals - We prioritize hiring based on culture and values, so you’re working with a team of folks who are as fun, talented and committed as you are

title: Logistics Coordinator (Remote) – Detail-Oriented & Reliable Only
description:
LOGISTICS COORDINATOR (REMOTE) —  DETAIL-ORIENTED & RELIABLE ONLY 



We are a fast-growing U.S. company looking for a highly detail-oriented Logistics Coordinator to 

manage all day-to-day logistics operations. 



If you are the kind of person who double-checks everything, catches small mistakes before they 

become big ones, and takes pride in accuracy — this role is for you. 



What You Will Do (Daily Responsibilities) 

You will own our logistics from end to end, including: 

- Label creation (accuracy is critical) 

- Routing cases to the correct clinics based on provided information 

- Assigning and verifying shipments 

- Double-checking packing lists and ensuring all items match 

- Tracking shipments daily and resolving delays 

- Communicating with carriers (FedEx, UPS, DHL, etc.) regarding delivery issues 

- Troubleshooting routing or carrier problems 

- Ensuring every case moves from A ? B with zero errors 

- Maintaining and updating logistics SOPs 

- Supporting our packing teams by providing correct daily routing information 



This is a high-accuracy, high-responsibility role. 



Even small mistakes can cause delays for clients, so you must be someone who takes 

ownership and pride in perfect work. 



Requirements 

You MUST be: 

- Extremely detail-oriented 

- Highly reliable (no disappearing, no missed tasks) 

- Comfortable with repetitive, accuracy-critical work 

- Strong in written English 

- Very organized with time and tasks 

- Comfortable working U.S. hours 

- Able to communicate quickly when needed 



If you tend to rush, cut corners, multitask too much, or dislike repetitive tasks, this role is not for 

you.

 

Preferred (not required) 

- Experience with logistics or shipping coordination 

- Experience with label creation platforms 

- Experience with e-commerce operations 

- Experience in administrative or operations roles that required high accuracy 



Hours 

- Part-time (3–5 hours per day) with potential to move into full-time as the company grows. 

- You must be available every day your shift is scheduled — the role is time-sensitive. 



Compensation 

- $6 per hour (part-time), depending on experience 

- Performance-based increases available 

- Long-term, stable role with room for growth 



What We Provide 

- Long-term employment 

- Training 

- A supportive operations team 

- Opportunities to grow into higher-level logistics or operations roles 

- Fast-paced environment with strong leadership and high standards 



How to Apply 

Send a message with: 

1. A short introduction about yourself 

2. Your experience with logistics + operations 

3. Your expected hourly salary 

4. Confirm you can work U.S.-aligned hours

title: Administrative Operations Manager
description:
Director of Administrative Operations

Skyline Exteriors Landscaping & Snow Removal, Inc.

Chicago, IL (Hybrid Leadership Role)



Position Overview

Skyline Exteriors Landscaping & Snow Removal, Inc. is seeking a Director of Administrative Operations to lead and optimize the company’s backend administrative infrastructure.

This role serves as the single point of accountability between the General Manager and the virtual administrative team. The 

Director of Administrative Operations is responsible for ensuring backend execution is accurate, efficient, system-driven, and profitability-focused.

- This is not an administrative assistant role.

- This is an operational leadership position focused on systems, accountability, and automation.

- The ideal candidate is structured, analytical, process-oriented, financially aware, and comfortable leading remote teams while implementing AI and workflow automation tools to improve efficiency.



Core Responsibilities

Backend Operations Leadership

Lead and manage all virtual administrative staff

Establish clear performance standards and KPIs

Conduct weekly team reviews and accountability meetings

Enforce SOP compliance and documentation standards

Oversee task delegation and workload distribution

Serve as the primary administrative point of contact for the General Manager



CRM & Pipeline Integrity

Maintain accuracy within Jobber, GHL, QuickBooks, and related systems

Ensure all inbound leads are logged and tracked correctly

Monitor pipeline stage accuracy and contract renewals

Oversee proper documentation of client records

Ensure clean and organized CRM data

Prevent revenue leakage due to system errors



- Billing & Accounts Receivable Oversight

Ensure recurring invoices are accurate and timely

Cross-check scope of work against billing

Monitor AR aging and payment patterns

Identify billing discrepancies and resolve errors

Coordinate with accounting to protect cash flow

Reduce administrative revenue loss



- Quality Assurance (QA) Enforcement

Enforce Quote, Schedule, Dispatch, and Invoice QA checklists

Track recurring administrative errors

Maintain exception logs

Refine workflows when errors repeat

Reduce owner and GM escalations caused by backend mistakes



- Workflow Optimization & Process Improvement

Map and document backend workflows

Identify operational inefficiencies

Improve SDR ? GM ? Admin handoffs

Streamline onboarding processes

Reduce redundancy and administrative friction

Continuously improve systems to support scalability



- AI & Automation Implementation

Identify repetitive tasks suitable for automation

Implement workflow automations (Zapier, Make, CRM automation tools)

Automate renewal reminders, AR follow-ups, and reporting

Reduce manual data entry through system integration

Build AI-assisted dashboards and reporting systems

Document automation processes and maintain system clarity



- Reporting & Operational Visibility

Deliver weekly reporting to leadership, including:

Pipeline health

AR summary

QA metrics



- Administrative workload tracking

Deliver monthly operational efficiency summaries

Monitor backend cost as a percentage of revenue

Track administrative productivity metrics

Administrative Profitability & Efficiency

Monitor backend labor efficiency

Track administrative error rates

Reduce rework and duplicate effort

Protect company NOI through disciplined execution

Improve administrative cost-to-revenue ratio over time



Required Qualifications

- 5+ years in operations, administrative leadership, or backend systems management

- Experience leading remote or virtual teams

- Strong CRM proficiency (Jobber, HubSpot, GHL, Salesforce, or similar)

- Experience with workflow automation tools (Zapier, Make, etc.)

- Familiarity with AI-based workflow optimization

- Strong organizational and analytical skills

- Financial literacy (understanding of revenue, margin, and operational cost structure)

- Ability to build and enforce structured processes

- Strong communication and leadership capabilities



Preferred Qualifications

- Experience in service-based industries (landscaping, construction, facilities management, or field services)

- Background in operational scaling

- Experience implementing automation in a growing business

- Experience improving administrative efficiency in multi-crew operations

- Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)

- CRM accuracy and cleanliness

- Billing error rate reduction

- QA checklist adherence rate

- AR aging improvement

- Administrative cost percentage reduction

- Automation implementation milestones

- Reduction in executive escalations

- Virtual team performance consistency



Compensation

Compensation will be competitive and aligned with experience ($,1200 - $2,000 per month)

This role offers long-term growth opportunity within a structured, performance-driven organization.



About Skyline Exteriors

Skyline Exteriors Landscaping & Snow Removal, Inc. is a Chicago-based exterior services company focused on recurring maintenance, operational discipline, and margin-protected growth. We operate with structured systems, clear accountability, and long-term value creation in mind.

- We are selective by design and focused on long-term fit.



How to Apply

Qualified candidates should submit:

A current resume outlining relevant operational leadership experience

A brief Loom video addressing:

- Why you are interested in this role

- Your experience leading remote teams

- Examples of systems or workflows you have built or improved

- Any experience implementing automation or AI tools

title: Success Operations Coordinator
description:
POSITION SUMMARY

The Success Operations Coordinator supports the onboarding and ongoing engagement of clients and their teams within the 10X Business Academy.  This role focuses on executing engagement plans, monitoring participation metrics, and maintaining proactive communication to ensure a positive learner experience.  The Coordinator partners closely with the Learner Success Manager to deliver consistent service, identify engagement risks early, and contribute to high client satisfaction and retention.



ABOUT CARDONE VENTURES

Our mission is to help business owners achieve their personal, professional, and financial goals through the growth of their businesses. We work in dozens of verticals and provide strategic business guidance through courses, live events, partnerships, and investments. Our core values are the backbone of our business and guide our hiring process: we are inspirational, accountable, transparent, disciplined, aligned, and results-oriented. This company operates nationally and is growing by the day.



SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE:

• Participation, course completion, and engagement metrics consistently meet or exceed benchmarks, demonstrating strong learner follow-through.

• Engagement gaps or client concerns are identified early and escalated appropriately, preventing negative impact on satisfaction or retention.

• Client records, tracking, and reporting are consistently accurate and timely, while the Coordinator demonstrates increasing ownership, confidence, and readiness for advancement to Learner Success Manager.



OBJECTIVES

• Support seamless onboarding of new clients and learners by coordinating orientation sessions, tracking setup completion, and ensuring timely follow-up communication.

• Monitor learner engagement metrics daily/weekly (course progress, participation, attendance, logins) and escalate risks to the Learner Success Manager.

• Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records in CRM and learning platforms.

• Conduct scheduled check-in calls and
 follow-ups using approved engagement frameworks.

• Execute engagement action plans developed by the Learner Success Lead.

• Identify disengagement patterns early and recommend proactive outreach strategies.

• Ensure client inquiries are responded to within established service-level timelines.

• Prepare client progress summaries and engagement reports for review by the Learner Success Lead.

• Coordinate scheduling of kick-off/accountability/coaching calls.

• Support accountability tracking by documenting team participation and milestone completion.

• Assist in renewal preparation by compiling engagement history and performance insights.

• Contribute to continuous improvement by documenting common learner challenges and recommending process enhancements.

• Uphold client confidentiality and data integrity standards.

• Demonstrate consistent adherence to communication and service quality standards.



COMPETENCIES

• Demonstrates patience, empathy, and professionalism in client interactions.

• Clear verbal and written communication in a global business environment.

• Follows structured workflows, checklists, and SOPs with accuracy.

• Builds rapport and trust with clients and learners.

• Consistently meets deadlines and follows through on commitments.

• Ability to interpret basic engagement metrics and recognize trends.

• Maintains high accuracy in documentation and reporting.

• Adjusts quickly to new systems, tools, and evolving processes.

• Works effectively with managers and cross-functional teams.

• Knows when to resolve independently and when to escalate.

• Effectively manages multiple client accounts simultaneously.

• Operates effectively in cross-border client relationships.

• Demonstrates willingness to learn coaching frameworks and client engagement strategies.

• Comfortable using CRM systems, online learning platforms, and productivity tools.



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

• Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Education, Communications, or related field preferred.

• 1–3 years of experience in customer service, account coordination, virtual support, BPO, or client-facing roles.

• Experience supporting global clients or working in remote environments is preferred.

• Familiarity with CRM systems and online learning platforms is an advantage.



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

• Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer



COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY

As an equal opportunity employer committed to meeting the needs of a multigenerational and multicultural workforce, Cardone Ventures recognizes that a diverse staff, reflective of our community, is an integral and welcome part of a successful and ethical business. We hire local talent at all levels regardless of race, color, religion, age, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, or disability, and actively foster inclusion in all forms both within our company and across interactions with clients, candidates, and partners.



If this position caught your eye, send us your resume! For best consideration, please complete the online application form:


/

SUCCESS LOOKS LIKE:

• Participation, course completion, and engagement metrics consistently meet or exceed benchmarks, demonstrating strong learner follow-through.

• Engagement gaps or client concerns are identified early and escalated appropriately, preventing negative impact on satisfaction or retention.

• Client records, tracking, and reporting are consistently accurate and timely, while the Coordinator demonstrates increasing ownership, confidence, and readiness for advancement to Learner Success Manager.



OBJECTIVES

• Support seamless onboarding of new clients and learners by coordinating orientation sessions, tracking setup completion, and ensuring timely follow-up communication.

• Monitor learner engagement metrics daily/weekly (course progress, participation, attendance, logins) and escalate risks to the Learner Success Manager.

• Maintain accurate and up-to-date client records in CRM and learning platforms.

• Conduct scheduled check-in calls and
 follow-ups using approved engagement frameworks.

• Execute engagement action plans developed by the Learner Success Lead.

• Identify disengagement patterns early and recommend proactive outreach strategies.

• Ensure client inquiries are responded to within established service-level timelines.

• Prepare client progress summaries and engagement reports for review by the Learner Success Lead.

• Coordinate scheduling of kick-off/accountability/coaching calls.

• Support accountability tracking by documenting team participation and milestone completion.

• Assist in renewal preparation by compiling engagement history and performance insights.

• Contribute to continuous improvement by documenting common learner challenges and recommending process enhancements.

• Uphold client confidentiality and data integrity standards.

• Demonstrate consistent adherence to communication and service quality standards.



COMPETENCIES

• Demonstrates patience, empathy, and professionalism in client interactions.

• Clear verbal and written communication in a global business environment.

• Follows structured workflows, checklists, and SOPs with accuracy.

• Builds rapport and trust with clients and learners.

• Consistently meets deadlines and follows through on commitments.

• Ability to interpret basic engagement metrics and recognize trends.

• Maintains high accuracy in documentation and reporting.

• Adjusts quickly to new systems, tools, and evolving processes.

• Works effectively with managers and cross-functional teams.

• Knows when to resolve independently and when to escalate.

• Effectively manages multiple client accounts simultaneously.

• Operates effectively in cross-border client relationships.

• Demonstrates willingness to learn coaching frameworks and client engagement strategies.

• Comfortable using CRM systems, online learning platforms, and productivity tools.



EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE

• Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Education, Communications, or related field preferred.

• 1–3 years of experience in customer service, account coordination, virtual support, BPO, or client-facing roles.

• Experience supporting global clients or working in remote environments is preferred.

• Familiarity with CRM systems and online learning platforms is an advantage.



PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

• Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer
